acf.heading: Get a Zyban (bupropion) prescription online.
acf.first_paragraph: Select your symptoms within the Maple app so the doctor can evaluate your symptoms and condition. Enter as much information as possible so that the doctor can make a thorough assessment.

accordion.accordion_title: What is Zyban (bupropion) and how does it work?
accordion.accordion_intro: Zyban is a type of medication known as an antidepressant, and is often used to help people stop smoking by reducing cravings and other withdrawal effects. This medication is thought to work by restoring the balance of certain natural chemicals (neurotransmitters) in the brain.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the uses for Zyban (bupropion)?
accordion.accordion_intro: Zyban is used to help people stop smoking and can decrease nicotine withdrawal symptoms such as irritability, anxiety, and restlessness. Further, this can decrease the risk of a variety of conditions including cancer, as well as heart and lung disease.

Zyban is available as a tablet and should be taken as directed by a doctor. It can be taken with or without food once a day. Tablet forms come in a 150mg dose, starting with one a day and can increase to 300mg per day (twice daily) if instructed by a doctor.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the side effects and risks of Zyban (bupropion)?
accordion.accordion_intro:
As your body adjusts to the medication, Zyban may cause:

  • Dry mouth, stuffy nose
  • Problems with vision or hearing
  • Nausea, vomiting, constipation
  • Sleep problems (insomnia)
  • Rashes
  • Headache, dizziness
  • Joint pain
accordion.accordion_content: Additionally, some users may experience seizures, confusion, blurred vision, fast or irregular heartbeats, or manic episodes. If any of these severe side effects occur, it is important to speak to a doctor as soon as possible.

accordion.accordion_intro: Zyban should not be taken by those who have used an MAO inhibitor in the past 14 days or are using Wellbutrin for depression. It should also not be taken by those who are allergic to bupropion or have a seizure disorder, an eating disorder (anorexia or bulimia), or have suddenly stopped using alcohol, seizure medication, or a sedative (Xanax, Valium, Fiorinal, or Klonopin).
accordion.accordion_content: If you have any questions about the medication, you can speak to a doctor on Maple by registering for an account.
